intro: Iryanthera crassifolia, commonly known as the thick-leaved beauty, is a species of flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its large, broad leaves and showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that are typically pink or red. It thrives in humid, tropical environments and is often found in shaded, moist forest understories. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and private collections.
